fieldGroup.template: Please download the template 'NTS: Non-technical summary' to draft the Non-technical summary (NTS) and provide it in the respective 'Documentation' section.

Royal Decree 118/2021, of February 23 2021, which modifies Royal Decree 53/2013, of February 1 2013, dictates that the person responsible for the project should write an anonymous non-technical summary (NTS) of the project and its eventual updates, which will be presented to the European Commission within a maximum period of six months from its authorisation.

Provided that intellectual property and confidential information are protected, the non-technical project summary will include, at a minimum, the following:

  • It will be anonymous and will not contain names nor addresses of users or people, nor any other personal data.
  • Information about the goals of the project, including damages and the benefits planned, as well as the number and guy of animals to be used.
  • Demonstration of compliance with the requirement of replacement, reduction and refinement.

The competent bodies may require that the non-technical summary of the project specify whether the project should be subject to a retrospective evaluation and, if so, establish the deadline. In this case, the non-technical summary of the project should be updated with the results of the retrospective evaluation within six months of the completion of this retrospective evaluation.

Once the project is authorised, the competent agency will publish the NTS on the website of the Ministry of Economy and Competitiveness.

For writing the NTS, templates are provided on the respective page on the website of the University Committee.
